tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE SecurityBreachForensics (
  breach_id INT,
  breach_date DATE,
  affected_records INT,
  breach_type VARCHAR(50),
  investigation_status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE SecurityBreachForensics (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  breach_date TIMESTAMP,
  breach_type VARCHAR(255),
  affected_systems ARRAY,
  breach_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE BreachInvestigation (
  investigation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  breach_id INT REFERENCES SecurityBreachForensics(id),
  investigator_name VARCHAR(255),
  investigation_notes TEXT,
  investigation_status VARCHAR(50)
);
CREATE TABLE SecurityBreachRecords (id INT PRIMARY KEY, date TIMESTAMP, event_type VARCHAR(50), description TEXT)
CREATE TABLE UserActivityLogs (id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_id INT, username VARCHAR(50), action VARCHAR(50), timestamp TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE ForensicReports (id INT PRIMARY KEY, case_id INT, report TEXT, investigator VARCHAR(50), date_generated DATE)

CREATE TABLE breaching_events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_date DATE,
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    summary TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE evidence_collection (
    evidence_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id INT REFERENCES breaching_events(event_id),
    evidence_type VARCHAR(50),
    evidence_details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE suspects (
    suspect_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    evidence_id INT REFERENCES evidence_collection(evidence_id),
    suspect_name VARCHAR(50),
    alias VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE investigation_reports (
    report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id INT REFERENCES breaching_events(event_id),
    report_date DATE,
    findings TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  breach_id INT,
  attacker_id INT,
  method_id INT,
  severity INT
);
